sentence:
Rather, I would like to give you a sense of the considerations that weigh on both sides of that debate and lay out the case for watching and waiting.1 The Outlook
Domestic real activity has proven reassuringly resilient.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of whether the stance will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral. It simply discusses the resilience of domestic real activity without providing any implications for monetary policy decisions.

sentence: Most notably, the labor market has continued to improve this year, pushing the economy closer to full employment.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of the labor market improving and the economy nearing full employment indicates a positive outlook, which may lead to a potential tightening of monetary policy to prevent overheating.

sentence: While monthly nonfarm payroll employment growth looks to have slowed over the past three months to a 167,000 monthly pace, so far this year it has averaged about 200,000.
reason: This sentence suggests that although there has been a recent slowdown in monthly nonfarm payroll employment growth, the average for this year remains around 200,000. This information is relevant to US monetary policy as it indicates a neutral outlook, neither hawkish nor dovish.

sentence: With these gains more than sufficient to absorb trend growth in the labor force, they have led to gradual increases in resource utilization.
reason: This sentence suggests that the gains in the labor force have been significant enough to accommodate the growth trend, resulting in gradual increases in resource utilization. It implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it does not explicitly indicate a hawkish or dovish approach.

sentence: At 5.1 percent in September, the unemployment rate has declined 1/2 percentage point since December.
reason: This sentence indicates a positive trend in the US labor market, suggesting a potential improvement in the economy. However, without further context, it is irrelevant to determine its implications on US monetary policy.

sentence: Alternative broader gauges of unemployment--which include individuals who are marginally attached to the labor force and employees working part-time for economic reasons--have also shown steady improvement this year.Even so, a variety of evidence suggests there may be some distance to go to achieve full employment.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. While alternative gauges of unemployment have improved, the mention of "some distance to go to achieve full employment" implies that the FOMC may continue to support accommodative measures to stimulate the labor market.

sentence: Although the unemployment rate is near longer-run norms, other measures of labor utilization are not.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. Despite the unemployment rate being close to its long-term average, the mention of other labor utilization measures implies that there are still significant underutilized resources in the economy. This indicates a need for accommodative monetary policy to support further job market improvements.

sentence: The labor force participation rate remains materially below the pre-recession trend, even after adjusting for demographics.2 And the share of employees working part time for economic reasons remains a full percentage point above the pre-recession level of around 3 percent, despite considerable recent improvement.
reason: This sentence suggests that the labor market is still not fully recovered from the recession, as the labor force participation rate and the number of employees working part-time for economic reasons are still not at pre-recession levels. This information is relevant to US monetary policy as it indicates a need for continued support and potentially dovish measures to stimulate the economy.

sentence: Even if there has been some trend increase in part-time work, it seems unlikely to account for all of the difference between current levels and pre-recession levels.3 Perhaps the most striking evidence in support of continued labor market slack is the absence of any acceleration in wages and prices.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the presence of labor market slack, indicated by the lack of wage and price acceleration, which implies that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) may not rush to tighten monetary policy due to concerns about inflationary pressures.

sentence: Our main gauges of wage inflation suggest that labor compensation is increasing at a pace of about 2 to 2-1/4 percent, little different from the rate of increase over the past several years.
reason: This sentence suggests that wage inflation is relatively stable and consistent with previous years, indicating a neutral stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Indeed, the lack of wage acceleration is likely one of the key reasons that many Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) participants have revised down their estimates of the longer-run level of the unemployment rate.
reason: This sentence suggests that the lack of wage acceleration has influenced FOMC participants to lower their estimates of the longer-run unemployment rate. It implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it indicates a cautious approach due to the absence of wage growth.

sentence: Most recently, a majority of participants moved their estimates below 5 percent.4 By comparison, in September 2012, the central tendency of estimates of the longer-run unemployment rate ranged from 5.2 to 6.0 percent.More broadly, domestic real activity appears likely to continue to grow at a moderate pace.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The majority of participants lowering their estimates below 5 percent indicates a cautious approach towards interest rate hikes. Additionally, the expectation of moderate growth in domestic real activity further supports a dovish outlook.

sentence: Domestic final sales, which exclude net exports and the volatile category of inventory investment, increased at an annual rate of 2-3/4 percent in the first half of the year, and recent indicators suggest a similar pace in the second half.
reason: This sentence suggests that domestic final sales have been growing at a moderate pace in the first half of the year and are expected to continue at a similar rate in the second half. This information is neutral and does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or irrelevant stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Perhaps most notable, personal consumption expenditures are estimated to have increased at an annual rate of a little over 3 percent in the three months ending in August, and auto sales moved up to a strong 18.1 million unit annualized pace in September.
reason: This sentence suggests a positive outlook on the US economy, indicating a hawkish stance on monetary policy. The strong increase in personal consumption expenditures and auto sales indicates robust economic growth, which may lead to a potential tightening of monetary policy by the Federal Reserve.

sentence: Thus, even though equity prices are down this year, continued job growth, lower gas prices, rising house prices and some loosening in consumer credit look likely to support consumer spending over the second half of the year.Moreover, domestic investment also looks to be increasing at a moderate pace despite the drag from the energy sector.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that despite the decline in equity prices, there are positive factors such as job growth, lower gas prices, rising house prices, and consumer credit loosening that are expected to support consumer spending. Additionally, it mentions that domestic investment is increasing moderately, despite the negative impact from the energy sector.

sentence: New orders and shipments of nondefense capital goods have turned up recently, pointing to positive equipment investment going forward, and investment in nonresidential buildings looks to have risen noticeably in the middle of the year.
reason: This sentence suggests a positive outlook for US monetary policy. The mention of new orders and shipments of nondefense capital goods turning up indicates a potential increase in equipment investment. Additionally, the noticeable rise in investment in nonresidential buildings further supports a positive economic trend. Overall, this statement is hawkish, indicating a potential inclination towards tightening monetary policy.

sentence: While investment in energy-related structures will likely move lower over the second half of the year in response to the most recent step-down in oil prices, the decline should be smaller than the sharp decline in the first half.Importantly, recent data suggest that the gradual recovery in housing continues.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The mention of a smaller decline in energy-related structures implies a potential positive impact on the economy. Additionally, the mention of a gradual recovery in housing indicates a positive trend.

sentence: Single-family building permits were close to an annual rate of 700,000 units in August, up nearly 5 percent from the fourth quarter of last year.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve.

sentence: The improvement in single- family housing is welcome after having been somewhat slow to materialize.
reason: This sentence suggests a positive development in the single-family housing sector, indicating a potential improvement in the overall economy. However, it does not directly address US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in terms of its implications on monetary policy.

sentence: Even so, current levels remain below what would be suggested by fundamentals, such as population growth.While private consumption and investment thus appear to be on reassuringly solid trajectories, growth in government expenditures on goods and services is likely to remain tepid.
reason: This sentence suggests that despite private consumption and investment showing positive trends, government expenditures are expected to have slow growth. This indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it highlights a potential imbalance between different sectors of the economy, which may require careful monitoring.

sentence: Combined purchases at the federal, state, and local levels rose at an annual rate of only 1-1/4 percent in the first half of the year, and modest growth in revenue at the state and local level suggest continued limited gains going forward.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The modest growth in revenue at the state and local level indicates limited gains, which implies a need for continued accommodative measures to support economic recovery.

sentence: In addition, spending restrictions in the Budget Control Act and the winding down of defense spending related to Afghanistan and Iraq have led to restraint at the federal level, although there is some uncertainty on the federal budget outlook.In contrast to the considerable progress in the labor market, progress on the second leg of our dual mandate has been elusive.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses spending restrictions and the federal budget outlook, which are not directly related to the monetary policy decisions made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: To be clear, I do not view the improvement in the labor market as a sufficient statistic for judging the outlook for inflation.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that the speaker does not consider the improvement in the labor market alone as a reliable indicator for predicting inflation. Therefore, it implies that other factors will be taken into account, making the sentence relevant to the assessment of monetary policy.

sentence: A variety of econometric estimates would suggest that the classic Phillips curve influence of resource utilization on inflation is, at best, very weak at the moment.
reason: This sentence suggests that the relationship between resource utilization and inflation, as indicated by the classic Phillips curve, is currently very weak. This implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy, as it indicates that inflation is not likely to be strongly influenced by resource utilization in the near term.

sentence: The fact that wages have not accelerated is significant, but more so as an indicator that labor market slack is still present and that workers' bargaining power likely remains weak.Overall inflation has been subdued, running persistently below our 2 percent target.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of wages not accelerating indicates labor market slack and weak bargaining power, implying a need for accommodative measures. Additionally, the mention of overall inflation persistently running below the target supports a dovish approach to stimulate economic growth.

sentence: The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index increased only 0.3 percent over the 12 months ending in August.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish implication on US monetary policy. The low increase of 0.3 percent in the PCE price index over the past 12 months indicates a lack of significant inflationary pressure, which may lead to a more accommodative stance by the Federal Reserve.

sentence: Much of the weakness in this index can be explained by the drop in oil and energy prices over the past year.
reason: This sentence suggests that the weakness in the index is primarily attributed to the decline in oil and energy prices. As it does not directly address US monetary policy, it is irrelevant to determining whether the statement is hawkish, dovish, neutral, or irrelevant.

sentence: Assuming energy prices stabilize going forward, as futures markets suggest, then energy should be a neutral or perhaps even a small positive influence on inflation next year.But inflation has been stubbornly low, even excluding energy prices.
reason: This sentence suggests that if energy prices stabilize, it could have a neutral or slightly positive impact on inflation next year. However, it acknowledges that inflation has remained persistently low, even when excluding energy prices. Therefore, this statement is dovish as it highlights concerns about low inflation despite potential energy-related influences.

sentence: Over the 12 months ending in August, core PCE prices, which exclude the often volatile categories of food and energy, increased 1.3 percent, and the 12-month change in core prices has been around 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 percent since the beginning of 2013.The persistence of the weakness in core price inflation deserves attention.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of the persistence of weakness in core price inflation indicates concern about low inflation levels, which may prompt the Federal Reserve to maintain or even lower interest rates to stimulate economic growth.

sentence: For the post-recession period as a whole, low levels of resource utilization surely accounted for a substantial part of the weakness.
reason: This sentence suggests that low levels of resource utilization have played a significant role in the weakness observed during the post-recession period. However, it does not provide a clear indication of the stance on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in determining whether it is hawkish, dovish, neutral, or irrelevant.

sentence: But resource utilization has increased dramatically since 2009, and core price inflation has remained quite low.A sizable decline in import prices over the past year has also contributed.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the increase in resource utilization since 2009 and the low core price inflation, indicating that there may not be a need for a hawkish approach. Additionally, the sizable decline in import prices further supports a dovish stance.

sentence: As a result of the sharp increase in the dollar over the past year or so, prices for non-oil imports fell at an annual rate of a little over 4 percent in the first half of the year and look to decline a further 2 percent at an annual rate over the second half.
reason: This sentence suggests that the sharp increase in the dollar has led to a decline in prices for non-oil imports. This could be seen as a dovish signal for US monetary policy, as it indicates a potential disinflationary pressure, which may prompt the Federal Reserve to consider accommodative measures to stimulate economic growth.

sentence: Estimates suggest the dollar's rise will hold down core inflation between 1/4 and 1/2 percentage point this year, restraint that would wane if the dollar stabilized going forward.However, recent weakness is not completely explained by import prices.
reason: This sentence suggests that the rise of the dollar is expected to have a restraining effect on core inflation, but this effect would diminish if the dollar stabilizes. However, it also implies that recent weakness in the dollar cannot be solely attributed to import prices. Therefore, this sentence is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights the potential impact of the dollar's stability on inflation, but it does not provide a clear indication of whether the stance would be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Services prices excluding energy, which are generally relatively little affected by changes in the dollar, have also shown no sign of acceleration in recent years.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that services prices, which are not significantly impacted by currency fluctuations, have not displayed any signs of increasing speed in recent years.

sentence: Instead, inflation in this category has moved lower over the past year.
reason: This sentence suggests that inflation in a specific category has decreased over the past year. As it does not directly address US monetary policy, it is irrelevant to determining whether the policy stance is hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: In August, the 12-month change in non-energy services prices was 2 percent, 1/4 percentage point lower than the pace of increase from 2012 through the middle of 2014.The outlook for inflation is critical for purposes of assessing progress toward our 2 percent goal, since monetary policy operates with a lag.
reason: This sentence indicates a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It highlights a decrease in non-energy services prices compared to previous years, which could suggest a potential slowdown in inflation. However, it also emphasizes the importance of the inflation outlook in assessing progress towards the 2 percent goal, indicating a cautious approach.

sentence: In this regard, the gravitational force of long-term inflation expectations is critically important.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC considers long-term inflation expectations to have a significant impact on US monetary policy. It implies a neutral stance as it emphasizes the importance of monitoring inflation expectations without explicitly leaning towards a hawkish or dovish approach.

sentence: Projections from the Survey of Professional Forecasters suggest that longer-run inflation expectations--which appear to be most relevant for predicting future inflation--have remained at 2 percent since the end of 2012.
reason: This sentence suggests that longer-run inflation expectations have remained stable at 2 percent since 2012, indicating a neutral stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Household surveys, such as University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers, suggest that households' longer-run inflation expectations have remained in a narrow range throughout the crisis and the recovery, although they have stayed in the lower end of that range over the past year.
reason: This sentence suggests that households' longer-run inflation expectations have remained relatively stable during the crisis and recovery, albeit towards the lower end of the range. It is relevant to US monetary policy as it provides insight into inflation expectations, which could influence the Federal Reserve's decision-making. However, it does not explicitly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: In contrast, market-based measures of inflation compensation, such as inflation swaps and the difference between nominal and inflation-indexed Treasury bond yields, have declined noticeably over the past year and a half at longer-term horizons.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The decline in market-based measures of inflation compensation indicates a lack of inflationary pressures, which may prompt the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) to maintain or even ease its current accommodative stance.

sentence: Of course, factors other than inflation expectations, such as changes in liquidity premiums and inflation risk premiums, may be at play.Although the balance of evidence thus suggests that long-term inflation expectations are likely to have remained fairly steady, the risks to the near-term outlook for inflation appear to be tilted to the downside, given the persistently low level of core inflation and the recent decline in longer-run inflation compensation, as well as the deflationary cross currents emanating from abroad--a subject to which I now turn.Over the past 15 months, U.S. monetary policy deliberations have been taking place against a backdrop of progressively gloomier projections of global demand.
reason: This sentence suggests that the risks to the near-term outlook for inflation in the US are tilted to the downside. It implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy, as the persistently low level of core inflation and the decline in longer-run inflation compensation are concerning factors. The mention of deflationary cross currents from abroad further supports a dovish stance.

sentence: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has marked down 2015 emerging market and world growth repeatedly since April 2014.In the second half of 2014, persistently weak aggregate demand in Japan and the Euro Area led to heightened deflationary pressures.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) mark down of emerging market and world growth, as well as weak aggregate demand and deflationary pressures in Japan and the Euro Area.

sentence: The policy response to these pressures and the anticipated divergence between the policy trajectory in these economies and the United States contributed to a 10 percent appreciation in the dollar in inflation-adjusted terms through the spring of this year, pushing down net exports and restraining activity in the United States.
reason: This sentence suggests that the policy response to pressures in other economies, along with the expected divergence in policy trajectory, had a significant impact on the US dollar, leading to a 10 percent appreciation. This appreciation negatively affected net exports and restrained activity in the United States. Therefore, it implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Net exports subtracted nearly 1 percentage point from the annual rate of U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) growth in the first part of the year, and the most recent trade data suggest another substantial subtraction in the third quarter.More recently, weakness in foreign demand has extended to emerging market economies, which now account for about half of world output and have been an important source of growth for more than the past decade.
reason: This sentence suggests that the weakness in net exports has been a significant drag on US GDP growth, and the most recent trade data indicates that this trend is likely to continue in the third quarter. The mention of weakness in foreign demand, particularly in emerging market economies, highlights the potential challenges faced by the US economy. However, since the sentence does not provide a clear indication of the FOMC's stance or any specific policy implications, it can be considered irrelevant to US monetary policy.

sentence: Growing recognition of this weakness pushed the dollar up further to 15 percent above its level last summer, and has contributed to a more general tightening of financial conditions in the past few months.Much of the focus has been on China, whose large size and double-digit growth rate put it at the center of a powerful global commodity super-cycle over the past decade.
reason: This sentence suggests that the growing recognition of weakness in the US economy has led to a stronger dollar and tighter financial conditions. It is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it primarily focuses on the impact of China's growth and global commodity super-cycle.

sentence: Consequently, the challenges China faces today are raising questions about emerging market growth prospects more broadly.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the challenges China faces and their impact on emerging market growth prospects, without directly addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: Most immediately, China's buildup of past property, and more-recent stock market, bubbles together with a steep run-up in business debt levels and questions about the policy stance and the outlook have raised concerns about downside risks.In weighing the implications for the U.S. outlook, it would be misleading to focus narrowly on the direct effect of U.S.-Chinese bilateral trade alone.
reason: This sentence suggests that the concerns about China's economic situation, including property and stock market bubbles, high business debt levels, and uncertainty about policy stance and outlook, have raised concerns about downside risks. However, it also implies that focusing solely on the direct effect of U.S.-Chinese trade would be misleading. Therefore, this sentence is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights the need for a broader perspective and a cautious approach, indicating a dovish stance.

sentence: Many commodity-exporting countries that have depended heavily on Chinese demand are adjusting with difficulty to the recent sharp commodity price declines.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the challenges faced by commodity-exporting countries due to declining commodity prices, without directly addressing the stance of US monetary policy.

sentence: After increasing at an average rate of nearly 5-1/2 percent over the period from 2003 through 2011, GDP growth in emerging market commodity exporters is projected to be only 3-1/2 percent this year.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the projected GDP growth of emerging market commodity exporters. It does not provide any indication of whether the US monetary policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Projected growth going forward has also been marked down materially.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The phrase "marked down materially" indicates a downward revision in projected growth, which could prompt the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) to adopt a more cautious and accommodative approach, potentially leading to a neutral or even dovish monetary policy stance.

sentence: Moreover, more developed economies, such as Mexico and Canada, our most important trading partners, have also been affected, with Canadian GDP declining in the first two quarters of the year.5 In addition, many non-commodity-producing East Asian economies are closely tied to China through trade and investment.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the impact of economic developments in Mexico, Canada, and East Asian economies on their respective GDPs and trade relations with China. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards interest rates or monetary policy.

sentence: Because of these ties, and for other idiosyncratic reasons, growth in East Asian economies has been weak so far this year.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the weak growth in East Asian economies, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: Growth in emerging Asia economies outside of China that are important destinations of U.S. exports slipped to 2-1/2 percent in the first half of the year, well below a trend rate of close to 5 percent.Downgrades to foreign growth affect the U.S. outlook through several channels.
reason: This sentence suggests that the growth in emerging Asia economies, which are significant destinations for U.S. exports, has slowed down to 2-1/2 percent, much lower than the expected trend rate of close to 5 percent. This downgrade in foreign growth could have implications on the U.S. outlook, potentially influencing the Federal Reserve's monetary policy decisions. However, without further context, it is difficult to determine whether this information is hawkish, dovish, neutral, or irrelevant.

sentence: First, weak growth abroad reduces demand for U.S. exports.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish implication on US monetary policy. Weak growth abroad reducing demand for US exports indicates a potential slowdown in the economy, which may prompt the Federal Reserve to adopt a more accommodative stance to stimulate growth.

sentence: Second, the expected divergence in U.S. growth increases demand for U.S. assets, putting upward pressure on the dollar, which, in turn, weighs on net exports.
reason: This sentence suggests that the expected divergence in U.S. growth is putting upward pressure on the dollar, which negatively impacts net exports. This implies a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it highlights the potential need to address the strong dollar to support exports.

sentence: The estimated effect of dollar appreciation on net exports has been shown to be substantial and to persist for several years.6 Weak demand weighs on global commodity prices, which, together with the effects on the dollar, restrains U.S. inflation.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the substantial and persistent impact of dollar appreciation on net exports, which, combined with weak global commodity prices, restrains US inflation. This implies that the Federal Reserve may adopt a cautious approach to monetary tightening to support economic growth.

sentence: Finally, the anticipation of weaker global growth can make market participants more attuned to downside risks, which can reduce prices for risky assets, both abroad and in the United States--as we saw in late August--with attendant effects on consumption and investment.Over the past year, a feedback loop has transmitted market expectations of policy divergence between the United States and our major trade partners into financial tightening in the U.S. through exchange rate and financial market channels.
reason: This sentence suggests that the anticipation of weaker global growth can lead to market participants being more cautious about downside risks, potentially resulting in reduced prices for risky assets. This is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights the potential impact of global economic conditions on consumption and investment. It implies a dovish stance, as it emphasizes the need for caution and potential negative effects on the economy.

sentence: Thus, even as liftoff is coming into clearer view ahead, by some estimates, the substantial financial tightening that has already taken place has been comparable in its effect to the equivalent of a couple of rate increases.Looking ahead, one of the biggest sources of known uncertainty to the U.S. outlook is whether this foreign weakness fades or intensifies.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges that liftoff (raising interest rates) is approaching, but also highlights the substantial financial tightening that has already occurred. The sentence also mentions the uncertainty caused by foreign weakness, which implies a cautious approach. Overall, the sentence does not lean towards a hawkish or dovish stance, making it irrelevant to US monetary policy.

sentence: A plausible baseline scenario might include a soft landing in China and growth in other emerging markets moving gradually back up to underlying trends.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges the possibility of a soft landing in China and gradual growth in other emerging markets, which implies that the FOMC does not see an immediate need for hawkish or dovish actions.

sentence: Of course, it is possible that a recovery in emerging market growth occurs sooner than in the baseline, such that the U.S economy moves modestly more quickly toward our goals.However, demand in emerging markets could also fall short of such a baseline.
reason: This sentence suggests that the possibility of a faster recovery in emerging market growth could lead to a more hawkish stance on US monetary policy, as the US economy may move more quickly towards its goals. However, it also acknowledges the potential for demand in emerging markets to fall short, which could make this statement somewhat neutral in terms of its implications on US monetary policy.

sentence: China is only part-way through challenging economic adjustments and financial market reforms, including reform of its exchange rate regime, debt deleveraging, and rebalancing of its economy toward more consumer-driven growth.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses China's economic adjustments and financial market reforms. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) or its implications on US monetary policy.

sentence: During this process, market participants may have less accuracy in forecasting developments in China relative to many other major economies due to less clarity regarding the macroeconomic data and the policy framework.
reason: This sentence suggests that the accuracy of market participants in forecasting developments in China is expected to be lower compared to other major economies. However, it does not directly address or imply any implications on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in terms of its impact on US monetary policy.

sentence: A more negative assessment of underlying Chinese growth fundamentals or its exchange rate regime would likely affect other important economies in the region, as well as commodity-producing economies, pushing global demand down further.
reason: This sentence suggests that a negative assessment of Chinese growth or exchange rate regime could have implications on other economies, including commodity-producing ones, potentially leading to a decrease in global demand. However, it does not directly indicate the stance of US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in determining whether it is hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence:
In turn, expectations of additional weakness in global demand could have important effects on the exchange rate of the dollar, the valuation of risky assets in the United States, and U.S. inflation, moving the economy further from our goals.Policy Considerations
There is a risk that the intensification of international cross currents could weigh more heavily on U.S. demand directly, or that the anticipation of a sharper divergence in U.S. policy could impose restraint through additional tightening of financial conditions.
reason: This sentence suggests that the intensification of international cross currents could potentially have important effects on the exchange rate, asset valuation, and inflation in the United States. It implies a dovish stance as it highlights the risk of a negative impact on U.S. demand and the potential need for additional tightening of financial conditions.

sentence: For these reasons, I view the risks to the economic outlook as tilted to the downside.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The use of "tilted to the downside" indicates a concern for potential economic risks, implying a preference for more accommodative measures to support the economy.

sentence: The downside risks make a strong case for continuing to carefully nurture the U.S. recovery--and argue against prematurely taking away the support that has been so critical to its vitality.These risks matter more than usual because the ability to provide additional accommodation if downside risks materialize is, in practice, more constrained than the ability to remove accommodation more rapidly if upside risks materialize.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It emphasizes the importance of continuing to support the US recovery and warns against prematurely withdrawing the existing support. It also highlights the limited ability to provide additional accommodation compared to the ability to remove accommodation quickly.

sentence: The asymmetry in risk management stems from the combination of the likely low current level of the neutral real interest rate and the effective lower bound.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of the likely low current level of the neutral real interest rate and the effective lower bound indicates a cautious approach towards managing risks, which aligns with a dovish monetary policy stance.

sentence: Let me take each in turn.First, casual empiricism would suggest that we are experiencing a period of unusually low rates not only in the United States but also at the global level.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of "unusually low rates" indicates a preference for maintaining or potentially lowering interest rates to stimulate economic growth, both domestically and globally.

sentence: Ten-year sovereign bond yields in G-7 economies excluding Japan currently range from just above 1/2 percent to just above 2 percent--well below the average range of 4 1/2 to 5 percent in the decade before the financial crisis.7 This observation receives substantial support from a number of rigorous empirical papers over the past year that have estimated the longer-run equilibrium federal funds rate to be lower now than previously.8 The projection of a relatively low neutral rate over the next few years also receives some weight in the September 2015 Summary of Economic Projections.
reason: This sentence suggests that the current low yields in G-7 economies, along with the estimation of a lower longer-run equilibrium federal funds rate, indicate a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The projection of a relatively low neutral rate further supports this dovish outlook.

sentence: Most FOMC participants lowered their estimate of the appropriate target level for the federal funds rate in the long run, and a majority of participants now forecast a level no higher than 3.62 percent--down from 4.12 percent in September 2012.9 A lower equilibrium funds rate implies a higher probability of policy being constrained by a lower bound for nominal interest rates.Second, the ability of policymakers to react to unexpected shocks using conventional tools remains highly asymmetric in the neighborhood of an effective lower bound.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The fact that most FOMC participants lowered their estimate of the appropriate target level for the federal funds rate in the long run indicates a more accommodative approach. Additionally, the mention of a lower equilibrium funds rate implies a higher probability of policy being constrained by a lower bound for nominal interest rates, further supporting a dovish outlook.

sentence: From the perspective of risk management, in today's circumstances, we have considerably greater latitude to adjust the path of policy in response to inflation that exceeds current forecasts than we have to provide additional accommodation in response to additional adverse shocks.Consider two possible scenarios.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. It indicates that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) has more flexibility to tighten policy in response to higher inflation than to provide further accommodation in the face of adverse shocks.

sentence: First, many observers have suggested that the economy will soon begin to strain available resources without some monetary tightening.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that the economy is expected to face resource strain, indicating a need for monetary tightening to prevent potential inflationary pressures.

sentence: Because monetary policy acts with a lag, in this scenario, high rates of resource utilization may lead to a large buildup of inflationary pressures, a rise in inflation expectations and persistent inflation in excess of our 2 percent target.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the concern that high rates of resource utilization could lead to inflationary pressures, exceeding the 2 percent target. This implies a potential need for tighter monetary policy to curb inflation and maintain price stability.

sentence: However, we have well-tested tools to address such a situation and plenty of policy room in which to use them.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC is confident in its ability to handle any potential economic challenges, indicating a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The mention of "well-tested tools" and "plenty of policy room" implies that the committee is prepared to take necessary actions, but does not lean towards a hawkish or dovish approach.

sentence: Moreover, the persistently deflationary international environment, the gradual pace of increases in U.S. resource utilization, the estimated small effect of resource utilization on inflation, the likely low level of neutral interest rates, and the persistence of inflation below our 2 percent target suggests this risk remains modest.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of persistently deflationary international environment, gradual pace of increases in US resource utilization, and the estimated small effect of resource utilization on inflation indicate a cautious approach towards tightening monetary policy. The mention of the likely low level of neutral interest rates and persistence of inflation below the 2 percent target further supports a dovish outlook.

sentence: Financial markets appear to agree, as five-year inflation compensation is well below 2 percent.Now, take the alternative risk: that the underlying momentum of the domestic economy is not strong enough to resist the deflationary pull of the international environment.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that financial markets anticipate low inflation, indicating a need for accommodative measures. Additionally, it highlights the risk of the domestic economy being negatively impacted by deflationary pressures from the international environment.

sentence: A further step-down in global demand growth and a further strengthening in the dollar could increase the already sizable negative effect of the global environment on U.S. demand, pushing U.S. growth back to, or below, potential.
reason: This sentence suggests that a potential further decline in global demand and a stronger dollar could worsen the negative impact of the global environment on US demand, potentially leading to a slowdown in US growth. It implies a dovish stance as it highlights concerns about the potential negative effects on the US economy.

sentence: Progress toward full employment and 2 percent inflation would stall or reverse.
reason: This sentence suggests that if progress towards full employment and 2 percent inflation stalls or reverses, it could have implications on US monetary policy. It implies a potentially negative outlook, which could lead to a more dovish stance by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) in terms of monetary policy decisions.

sentence: With limited ability to ease policy, it would be more difficult to move the economy back on track.Indeed, many central banks in advanced economies have tightened policy since the financial crisis, prompted by improving domestic activity.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that with limited ability to ease policy, it would be challenging to stimulate the economy. Additionally, it highlights that many central banks in advanced economies have tightened policy, indicating a trend towards a less accommodative stance.

sentence: In these cases, the tightening was reversed as the outlook evolved.
reason: This sentence suggests that the tightening of US monetary policy was reversed due to changes in the economic outlook. It implies a dovish stance, indicating a willingness to adjust policy based on evolving conditions rather than maintaining a consistently hawkish approach.

sentence: Given the current uncertainty, we should put some weight on the risk of following this pattern.
reason: This sentence suggests a cautious approach to US monetary policy due to the existing uncertainty. It implies a neutral stance as it acknowledges the need to consider the potential risks associated with following a particular pattern, without explicitly leaning towards a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: Indeed, market participants put the probability of returning to the zero lower bound within two years of liftoff at 20 percent.10 To be fair, the past few years have demonstrated the capacity and will of central banks in many jurisdictions to deploy unconventional monetary policy tools, including quantitative and credit easing, forward guidance, and negative rates.
reason: This sentence suggests that the market participants believe there is a 20 percent chance of the US monetary policy returning to the zero lower bound within two years of liftoff. It also acknowledges the past few years' demonstration of central banks' ability and willingness to use unconventional monetary policy tools. However, it does not provide a clear indication of whether the sentence is hawkish, dovish, neutral, or irrelevant to US monetary policy.

sentence: That said, resorting to such tools is not without costs and uncertainties.We should not take the continued strength of domestic demand growth for granted.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It acknowledges the potential drawbacks and uncertainties associated with using certain tools, indicating a cautious approach. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of not assuming sustained domestic demand growth, which aligns with a neutral stance.

sentence: Although the outlook for domestic demand is good, global forces are weighing on net exports and inflation, and the risks from abroad appear tilted to the downside.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of global forces weighing on net exports and inflation, along with the risks from abroad being tilted to the downside, indicates a cautious approach towards tightening monetary policy.

sentence: Our economy has made good progress toward full employment, but sluggish wage growth suggests there is some room to go, and inflation has remained persistently below our target.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. Despite the good progress towards full employment, the mention of sluggish wage growth and persistently low inflation indicates that there is still room for improvement before considering any hawkish actions.

sentence:
With equilibrium real interest rates likely to remain low for some time and policy options that are more limited if conditions deteriorate than if they accelerate, risk-management considerations counsel a stance of waiting to see if the risks to the outlook diminish.References
Aaronson, Stephanie, Tomaz Cajner, Bruce Fallick, Felix Galbis-Reig, Christopher Smith, and William Wascher (2014).
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of "equilibrium real interest rates likely to remain low" implies a need for accommodative measures. Additionally, the reference to "policy options more limited if conditions deteriorate" indicates a cautious approach, aligning with a dovish stance.

reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it expresses gratitude towards Andrew Figura for his assistance in preparing the text, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on the matter.

reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it clarifies that the remarks expressed are personal opinions and not reflective of the official stance of the Federal Reserve Board or the Federal Open Market Committee.

sentence: But even holding demographics constant, the participation rate is considerably lower now than before the recession, suggesting it is cyclically depressed.
reason: This sentence suggests that the current lower participation rate in the US, even when considering constant demographics, is due to cyclical factors rather than structural ones. This information is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Aaronson and others (2014) find that demographics can explain only about half of the decline in the participation rate since the end of 2007.Thus, it may be a while further before the participation rate fully reacts to the full amount of improvement in labor market conditions that we have seen thus far, since wage growth has remained low, and the decision to participate in the labor force may respond with a lag to cyclical improvements.
reason: This sentence suggests that the decline in the participation rate since 2007 cannot be fully explained by demographics alone. It implies that the participation rate may not fully react to improvements in the labor market conditions due to low wage growth and a lag in the decision to participate. Therefore, it is irrelevant to the current US monetary policy.

sentence: Changes in the structure of labor demand, such as a shift toward occupations or industries characterized by flexible and part-time hours, may have led to an increase in the equilibrium level of part-time work.
reason: This sentence suggests that changes in labor demand, specifically towards flexible and part-time occupations, may have caused an increase in the equilibrium level of part-time work. However, it does not directly address or imply any implications on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in this context.

sentence: If workers combine two or more part-time jobs to arrive at a full-time workweek, part-time employment could be elevated with average weekly hours at normal levels.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. It highlights the possibility of workers combining part-time jobs to achieve a full-time workweek, which could result in elevated part-time employment. However, it also mentions that average weekly hours would remain at normal levels, indicating that this situation may not have a significant impact on the overall labor market.

sentence: But the logistical costs of multiple job holding make such an outcome unlikely, and in recent years elevated part-time employment has not coincided with an increase in official estimates of multiple job holding.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses logistical costs and part-time employment, which do not directly relate to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on interest rates. Therefore, it does not provide any implications that are hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the impact of exchange rates on net exports and real GDP in a broad set of countries, without specifically addressing the US. reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the current level of interest rates in Japan and their decline over the past decade. It does not provide any indication or implications for the stance of US monetary policy, making it unrelated and irrelevant.

sentence: Building on the work of Laubach and Williams (2003), both Hamilton, Harris, Hatzius, and West (2015) and Kiley (2015), for example, have recently constructed alternative estimates of the longer-run equilibrium federal funds rate.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it only mentions the work of various researchers in constructing alternative estimates of the longer-run equilibrium federal funds rate. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: While these papers differ in their estimates and acknowledge a considerable amount of uncertainty, they all weigh in on the side of a relatively low equilibrium federal funds rate over the next few years.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. The papers mentioned indicate that there is a consensus on expecting a relatively low equilibrium federal funds rate in the coming years, implying a cautious approach towards interest rate hikes.
